class_notes: An individual's nutrient and energy requirements change over the life span. This course will explore the nutritional foundations of growth, development, and normal functioning in each stage of the life span, from pre-pregnancy to older age. We will examine the physiological and developmental basis for changing nutrient requirements over each stage and consider evidence-based age- and life stage-specific dietary recommendations to prevent nutrient deficiencies, promote health, and prevent disease. Sociological influences across the lifespan will also be considered.
course_description: This course examines the physiological basis for changing nutrient needs throughout the life cycle. Topics may include growth and development, nutrition assessment, age-specific dietary recommendations for optimal health and disease prevention, and sociocultural influences on dietary patterns.
prerequisites: HLTH 220 or HLTH 221 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
